utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: So what makes you so sure that Alexis isn’t serious about this guy?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t met him or approved of him yet, so it can’t be serious. All suitors must be met and intimidated by me personally before they can be considered for official boyfriend status.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I would not do that.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her body was in that barrel over there. Burned. And I mean beyond recognition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any chance of a positive ID?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not from fingerprints. But bone structure tells me it’s a young woman, about 5’4”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So a transient?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I doubt it. There’s a bullet hole in the back of her head. And then there’s her teeth. Every one of them was knocked out of her mouth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So much for dental records.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone obviously went to great lengths to make sure she disappeared.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: So none of these guys saw anything. They panhandle by day and don’t come back here ‘til it’s dark.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: First guy who showed up said the fire was already going. Sounds like a dump job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, we have a female. She’s 5 foot 4. Let’s start looking through missing persons reports.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wait. You may not have to do that. A titanium screw. From her jaw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dental implant.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And there’s a batch number. Which could give us her name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We traced that dental screw to Melanie Rogers, 27. Lived in New Jersey near Rutgers University where she was a post-doc engineer in ecofriendly design. By all accounts she was well-liked, respected. No one I talked to had any idea who could have done this to her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s an engineer from New Jersey doing in a barrel in Manhattan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but something was going on with her. I pulled her phone records for yesterday. She made half a dozen calls to the same number in a 20 minute period.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could be. It’s a 202 number, but it’s listed as blocked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 202 … uh, that’s Washington D.C.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. Preliminary check shows it’s a cell phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means whoever it is might be in the city. Whoever it is, let’s get a warrant on that phone number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She made one other call after that around 4PM. And then after that all her phone activity went dark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was the call to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was to her half-sister, Julie. I took a look, she’s her only family. She works as a loan officer in Midtown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bring her in. She might be able to shed some light.

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: Melanie and I were never all that close. But when our dad got sick we … um … we found each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what your sister was doing in the city yesterday?

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: No. She came in from time to time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know if she was dating anyone recently?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone from D.C. perhaps?

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: Not that I knew about. Although, just two nights ago she met me for dinner. She mentioned meeting a friend afterwards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she say who?

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: Well, I asked, but she said that she couldn’t talk about it for some reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So when you spoke with her yesterday did it sound like anything was wrong?

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: I never spoke to her yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He phone records indicate she called you about 4 o’clock.

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: 4? No, I was in a meeting. Oh my God. She left a message.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Hey, it’s me. Listen, I think something’s going on. Something’s not right. I’m pretty sure someone’s after me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s in a parking structure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can hear two sets of footsteps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: If anything happens, tell them X T 3.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She recorded her own murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, parking structure. Letters and numbers. Sounds like she’s reading off a license plate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of the guy that was following her. And X T 3, I mean, there’s going to be thousands of plates with that partial. Can you play the end again? I thought I heard something after the phone hit the ground.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: If anything happens, tell them X T 3.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There. Did you hear that? There was a click.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Let me see what I can do with that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lighter. That’s a Zippo lighter. So he killed Melanie and then stopped to have a cigarette.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we might be dealing with a psychopath.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So that D.C. number? Looks like whoever owns it was in town. She called it the other night right after dinner with her sister.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When she said she was meeting someone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s right. Credit card record says that she was in a cab just a few minutes later. I tracked down the driver. Said he dropped her off at the Standish Hotel at 11PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps she was meeting her Washington friend for a secret tryst?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Makes sense. The Standish is popular with married men who value discretion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe someone at the hotel saw her with him.

utterance.speaker: CONCIERGE
utterance.content: I’m really not sure. So many people come through here every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look again. And keep in mind, this is a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: CONCIERGE
utterance.content: I might have seen her a few times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about two nights ago?

utterance.speaker: CONCIERGE
utterance.content: Probably.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was she meeting someone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m gonna need a name.

utterance.speaker: CONCIERGE
utterance.content: Look, our clients value their privacy. You’re really putting me in an awkward position here.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Oh, you think this is awkward? Wait ‘til I get a warrant and start questioning all the people that have stayed here over the past year.

utterance.speaker: CONCIERGE
utterance.content: Fine. You didn’t hear it from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It can’t be. Melanie was having an affair with Senator Bracken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s it. Esposito’s confirmed it. The number that Melanie was calling was Senator Bracken’s cell phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Late night phone calls, secret hotel meetings. Bracken was having an affair with Melanie. She must have become a liability.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or she stumbled on to something that he was involved in and became a threat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he dealt with her. Same way he dealt with your mother and tried to deal with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is it, Castle. This is my chance to finally make him pay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we have to be cautious. We know what happens to people who go after him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except this time he doesn’t know we’re on to him. We’ve got the advantage here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do we? What do you think he’s going to do when he sees you coming?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How many people do you think this bastard put in the ground to get here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, remember. We’re only here to see if he can help us locate Melanie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Let him think he got away with it. Like he does everything else. You know, I was really hoping the next time I saw this guy would be down the barrel of my gun.

utterance.speaker: BENJAMIN MOSS
utterance.content: You sure I can’t change your mind? I could really use your help on this one, Bill.

utterance.speaker: SENATOR WILLIAM BRACKEN
utterance.content: I would if I could, you know that. You also know what this legislation is to me.

utterance.speaker: BUTLER
utterance.content: Senator. Some detectives here to see you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry to trouble you, Senator. This won’t take long.

utterance.speaker: SHIELA BRACKEN
utterance.content: What’s this about, Bill?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’m not sure. You look familiar. Have we met?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t think so, sir. Is there someplace we can talk?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’d offer you both a drink, but I get the feeling this is an official call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’d just like to ask you a few questions about someone. Melanie Rogers?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. I know Melanie. She’s a great girl. Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s – she’s missing. Since yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: She’s missing? That’s terrible. Whatever I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw Ms. Rogers?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Just yesterday. We’re both attending the same eco-conference in the city.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. So you ran into her there?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: No, I’m uh, giving the keynote address and she was helping me with my speech.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, so she works for you?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Not exactly. She agreed to consult with me on a very important piece of legislation that I’m unveiling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So she’s an non-paid consultant?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I suppose. Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s just that you were seen at the Standish Hotel together two nights ago.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: What are you implying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re just trying to establish a timeline of Melanie’s whereabouts.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: The hell you are. You’re trying to take a professional relationship and use it against me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, man. We’re not trying to jam you up –

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I know where I’ve seen you. You work with Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We just have a few more questions.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Then call my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well the guy’s guilty as hell, but he has an alibi. He was at some conference all day. Ryan’s checking it out now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s gonna check out. He never does this on his own. He always sends someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay, so now not only do we have to find this killer, but we have to connect him to Bracken.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Except we have no idea where to start looking. We don’t even have a real crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but we’re getting closer. The FBI performed an analysis of Melanie’s voicemail. It was a call made from a parking garage where she was abducted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They identified the background noise as a hydraulic motor of a TC-501 tower crane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tower cranes are used in heavy construction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means the garage is near a construction site. And only 12 sites in the city are currently using that crane.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so Bracken’s alibi checked out. Witnesses put him at the Golden Ecological Conference all day yesterday. They also confirmed that Melanie was there, just like he said. She was seen leaving at 3:45.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Melanie left the voicemail from the parking garage at 4.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where was that conference being held?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: At the Widmark Hotel, downtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Widmark. That’s 5 blocks from that construction site.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is right next to a parking garage.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett! You need to see this!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: XT3. Just like in Melanie’s voicemail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you run the plates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, just came back stolen reported 4 days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you guys check inside. Espo, pop the trunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I may be wrong, but that looks like a sniper rifle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You wouldn’t be wrong.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Widmark Hotel. That’s where their conference is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Didn’t Bracken say that he was giving a speech there in a couple of days?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think Bracken’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He isn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s the target.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Based on what we found in the car, someone was planning on shooting the Senator at the Eco Conference tomorrow night while he delivers his keynote speech.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: And if our suspect is still out there he’s still a threat. Did we get any prints off that duffle bag?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet, sir. CSU’s still dusting the car, the notebook, and everything else in the bag, including the rifle. Now, we have serial numbers on the rifle and we’re looking into those.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And our victim. How did Melanie Rogers get mixed up in this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somehow she stumbled onto his plot and he killed her.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Excuse me. It’s the Mayor. Keep me posted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We might have a description of our potential shooter. Widmark security stopped someone from getting into the conference without proper credentials.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two days ago. Caucasian, baseball cap, beard, long stringy hair, and he was carrying a large grey duffle bag just like that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What time?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They said it was about 3:45PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s when Melanie left the conference. In her message she said something wasn’t right. What if she saw this guy and followed him to the garage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, grab Espo and a sketch artist. Go down and talk to security at the Widmark. I want a picture of this guy in circulation within the hour.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was finally going to put this guy away, Castle. And now I’m protecting the man who killed my mother.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Senator, we can provide you with an increased security detail. But until we apprehend this man, I recommend you postpone your speech.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF OF STAFF EVAN HOWARD
utterance.content: Is that really necessary? I mean, isn’t the threat all but neutralized?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we haven’t stopped him. Look, we’re talking about someone that is ruthless, methodical. Someone that killed Melanie Rogers just to keep her from talking. That suggests a person that is intent on seeing this through.

utterance.speaker: HOWARD
utterance.content: Yes, but you said you could increase his security detail. Look, this isn’t just any conference. The Senator is going to unveil a far-reaching environmental initiative that is the cornerstone of his term. We have issued dozens of press credentials –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Senator, I cannot guarantee your safety.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’m speaking at that conference. This keynote address puts me on the national stage. I’m not going to run and hide just because some whacko with a notebook made a threat. Now, I suggest that you people do whatever it takes to stop this man. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Very well, Senator. Detective Beckett will need a moment with you.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Because she’s leading the investigation.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Is there some reason you don’t want to work with Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Let’s find someplace private, shall we, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Well. Hard to miss the irony of this situation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Senator Bracken, do you have any enemies? Is there anyone you can think of that would like to kill you?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I get threatening letters and emails all the time. Comes with the office. My chief of staff keeps a file.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone with a legitimate claim?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: A man doesn’t get to my position without upsetting people along the way. Most of them aren’t crazy enough to want to kill me. Present company excluded.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know Senator, I’m not the one you should be worried about right now.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: It’s just us here, Detective. A shooter on the loose, me in the crosshairs. Must be a dream come true for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In my dreams I’m the one that gets to pull the trigger. But you know, if you’re not comfortable with me leading this investigation you’re welcome to step outside and tell everyone why.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, I guess we’re stuck with each other. So then let me make one thing clear. This man killed Melanie Rogers. And when someone commits murder, whoever he is, Senator, I will bring him to justice. No matter how long it takes.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’ll have my chief of staff send over the letters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll tell you something. If I’m her, I sit in there shuffling papers until whoever it is puts a bullet in Bracken’s head.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No you wouldn’t. Because that would make you no better than he is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy murdered Beckett’s mother. Captain Montgomery. Who knows who else. Bracken’s got it coming to him. So I say let it come.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The mayor’s asking for an update. What’s the latest?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Serial number on that rifle led us to a hunting store in Patterson, New Jersey. The owner ID’d our suspect from the sketch. The paperwork indicates that several firearms were purchased, but the name and address are all bogus.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, take a few units to canvass the area near the store and take the sketch of our suspect.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any word from CSU?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir. They discovered part of a receipt with a smudge on it in the duffle bag, been trying to get a partial print off of that. There’s no point of sale on the receipt, but the SKU number matched that hat. Manufacturer’s sending over a list of outlets in the tri-state area, but there’s over 200 locations.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Focus on the ones in Jersey first. 24 hours before Bracken speaks. Maybe Beckett will have better luck with those threat letters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Man, these people need to get a life. Most of these guys it seems like their only companionship is the space alien that talks to them through their microwave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, there’s a lot of lonely, confused people out there. But so far none of the letters match the handwriting in our suspect’s notebook.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Considering what he’s capable of, you would think Bracken would have more … formidable enemies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, obviously you never saw the letter that I sent him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I did actually. I liked the way you uh, dotted the ‘I’ in kill with a little heart. It was a nice touch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I was trying to give it a personal feel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’re really not going to talk about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, Castle, what is there to talk about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honestly? Practically … everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why all I can do is treat it like another case. Because that’s what it is. It’s – – just like any other case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re tired, Castle. Why don’t you go get some rest?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. I can stay if you like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. C’mon. Go. I’ll call you if I need anything, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really are remarkable, you know that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve been working on this case where I have to find a suspect and I came across a piece of evidence. It’s a letter that he wrote and there’s no address. There’s no name. Just a postmark from New Jersey. And I know in my gut that this is our big break. One way or another it’s going to lead us straight to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we find this suspect, someone worse, much worse, is going to escape justice.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: I take it no one else knows about the letter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: As a police officer you must have faced similar dilemmas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Why is this time different?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because this time it feels like there’s no right choice.

utterance.speaker: BURKE
utterance.content: Maybe the right choice is the one you can live with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. You guys seen Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. Not since last night. We thought she was with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I tried her a couple of times this morning, but wasn’t picking up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, thanks. Yo, I’m trying to get through this list of stores that sell the baseball caps. Half of them aren’t even open yet. What about you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nada. A canvass around the gun store turned up empty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, where are we on the suspect?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nowhere. And Senator Bracken speaks in 10 hours. You find anything in those letters?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Nothing significant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You doing all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, there’s something that I –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just heard back from CSU on that receipt from the duffle bag.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They get a print off that smudge?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but it contained traces of synthetic motor oil and brake pad residue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like our guy’s a mechanic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe he was shopping for the rifle near work. Where’s that store again?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Patterson. Just off the highway.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s the place to start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, I’m going to get you guys addresses on your way. I’ll compile a list of every service station within a five mile radius and we’ll expand from there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were you going to say something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, we’re past it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who knew Patterson had so many service stations, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure we left Patterson five shops ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ugh. Back in 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well we don’t have 20 minutes to waste. Let’s move on to the next one. We’ll circle back around.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, wait a minute. Hey, look on top of the counter. They sell those hats here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Open up! Police business!

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: All right, I’m coming. Relax! Don’t break my glass. Yeah, I see it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’re you doing? NYPD. Do you know this guy?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Maybe. He looks like one of my mechanics. I mean, he used to be. I laid him off like 3 weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any paperwork he might have filled out? Maybe a work order?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I might have something back here.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s it right there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Handwriting’s a match. It’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Robert McManus. Has a history of schizophrenia, multiple stays at a psych ward. Recent episodes were triggered by his son’s death.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Where are we on deployment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Every beat cop in the city has his photo. SWAT is sitting on his place in Jersey, but his neighbors say he hasn’t been there in a month. He disappears for long stretches.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m scouring through his financials, but they are severely outdated. Guy closed his accounts years ago. Basically living off the grid.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Got something. We canvassed near a diner McManus used to frequent. An SRO desk clerk just ID’d him. He’s been staying there a month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take the place apart. Look for anything that might lead us to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We should check the rest of the building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll talk to the manager for details on his routine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Show me your hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move. Don’t move or I’ll shoot!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Just spoke to Ryan. McManus is still out there, but the boys are going door to door in every building nearby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I had him in my sights. I had him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you missed. So what? It could happen to anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I didn’t miss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I found a letter. In the threats file. It was from McManus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long have you known about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since last night. McManus was accusing Bracken of murdering his son. I looked into it. He was a 24 year old kid. He was an intern for Bracken’s reelection campaign. He had a meeting scheduled with a reporter and the next day they found him hanged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you think Bracken –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I almost suppressed evidence. I was going to burn that letter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t miss McManus. I looked him in the eye and I saw his pain. And I couldn’t take that shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if I wanted him to get away? Wanted him to go through with this? Then what does that make me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there anything new?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Nothing yet on McManus. But a search of his room turned up wires, detonator, traces of C4. Looks like he was building a bomb.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bomb, uh – did anyone find it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No. If he built something it’s either with him or already out there waiting to go off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, hang on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He had a rifle, Castle. A rifle. Not a bomb. If he detonates that thing tonight at the conference and innocent people get hurt –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, this is not your fault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? How is it not my fault? I’m a cop. I had a job to do and I didn’t do it. I’ve got to make this right. I’ve got to find that bomb and save Bracken’s life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like you might have some help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Found him hiding on a rooftop three blocks away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the bomb?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Asked him about it. Asked him about Melanie Rogers, too. He’s not much of a talker.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He hasn’t said a word since we picked him up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take him to interrogation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What makes you think he’s going to talk to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘cause. I know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi Robert. I’m Kate. Why don’t you take those things off? They look uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know what it’s like to lose someone that you love. To live with that pain. To feel the rage towards the person responsible for it. Towards Bracken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He took someone close to me. He killed my mother. And then he went after my friends. Even tried to kill me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Is she talking about Bracken?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s … just trying to get through to him any way she can.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT MCMANUS
utterance.content: The man killed my son. No one cared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I care.

utterance.speaker: MCMANUS
utterance.content: He needs to pay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not with a bomb, Robert. You and me, we’re not like him. We don’t hurt innocent people. Where’s the C4?

utterance.speaker: MCMANUS
utterance.content: You’re trying to confuse me. Trick me into saying something I shouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m trying to take down Bracken, same as you. And we’ve gotta do it the right way. You and me, we’re on the same side, Robert.

utterance.speaker: MCMANUS
utterance.content: You’re on his side. He controls everybody. You’re all in his pocket. Every last one of you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No I’m not. I’m just like you, Robert.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She’s losing him.

utterance.speaker: MCMANUS
utterance.content: You’re not like me. You’re making stuff up. Making up stories. If you went through what I went through you would want to see him dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everything that I told you was true. Robert, look at me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the C4? If that thing goes off then there’s blood on our hands, and I cannot live with that, and I know that you can’t, either.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective? A word.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I can do this. I can reach him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It’s over, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, just give me another minute.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I just got a call from the Feds. They found the bomb.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: McManus rented a box at a post office. The C4 was there. He’d wired it into a vest. He’d also obtained credentials for the conference somehow.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Well, thank you, Captain. For everything you’ve done.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well actually, Detective Beckett deserves most of the credit. She led the team. Excuse me, Senator. Good afternoon, Mr. Mayor.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I heard how you led the team. You fired, what, two shots from close range and both of them missed? All this talk about justice. I guess I was right about you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Check this out. What better way to celebrate the end of a difficult case then with a bottle of – – what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at this vest McManus supposedly made. The zip ties and wires. They’re expertly done. You saw McManus. He was barely able to button his own shirt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In his current state, no. But he could have done this while he was still on his meds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about Melanie’s body? He burned it and he knocked out her teeth to keep it unidentifiable. And then he leaves a duffle bag in a stolen car for us to find? That doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he’s mentally ill. I mean, not everything he does is going to make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No Castle, something is not right. That Zippo lighter we heard on Melanie’s voicemail. McManus doesn’t smoke. We didn’t find a Zippo in any of his things.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate … Let it go. I mean, you don’t have anything to prove. Not to Bracken. Not to me, not to yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this isn’t about proving something. This is about evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, all the evidence – the letter, the notebook, the bomb – everything traces back to McManus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if somebody wanted us to find him? What if they’re framing him? So that everyone would think that the threat was over while the real assassin is still out there. The C4 in the vest. What if that was the bomb we were supposed to find? What if there’s another bomb that’s still out there planned for the keynote address? That’s an event that the time and place has been known for weeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, if a bomb went off during Bracken’s speech they could say McManus set it before he was apprehended.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bracken’s supposed to go on stage at 8 o’clock. That’s 20 minutes away. Look, I know that I don’t have any proof. I know that this sounds crazy –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you know how determined Bracken was to give this speech. If you stop it and you’re wrong? Your career is over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if I’m right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Detective Beckett, badge number 41319. I’m calling for the evacuation of the Widmark Hotel.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, why don’t you see if you can get an update from the bomb squad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here? Who called in the bomb squad?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We had a credible threat, sir.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Credible according to who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we should speak alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe someone that you know is trying to kill you.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: What? You already have the man in custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe that McManus was set up because of the threatening letter he sent you, which means the individual involved has access to the files in your office.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: And you have evidence for all of this? You don’t have evidence?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’m not going to make this kind of accusation lightly.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Are you – so you called in a bomb scare based on – on what? A hunch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BOMB SQUAD MEMBER KOCH
utterance.content: We finished our sweep of the primary target area, Detective. We found no explosive device.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the stage? Did you check the podium?

utterance.speaker: KOCH
utterance.content: We swept everything in a 50 foot radius of where the Senator would be speaking.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: All right, this is ridiculous. Let’s just get everybody back inside.

utterance.speaker: KOCH
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Senator. We still have to conduct a thorough search of the building. It’s going to take a few more hours, I’m afraid.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: You think I don’t know what you’re doing? You let McManus get away so he would take me down, and when that didn’t play out you decided to ruin the most important moment of my career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not what this is about.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: You save that for the review board! You have overplayed your hand. And I am going to bury you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, Castle. I don’t understand. How did we get this so wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We knew we were taking a risk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s got to be a reason that they were framing McManus. They had to have been planning this for tonight. Here. It’s the only thing that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he wasn’t being framed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe they couldn’t get the bomb in the building. With the heightened security because McManus was on the loose, maybe they had to make a different plan. Place the bomb somewhere more accessible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! The driver!

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: His name is Noah Charles. He was my driver for 5 years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any reason he would suddenly want you dead?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I assume because someone paid him a great deal of money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t seem shocked.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: It’s another world out there, Mr. Castle. One that most people don’t see, run by money, influence, power. And the people in it will do anything they can to stay on top. But I assume that you already know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wouldn’t have done it, you know. What she did. I’d’ve stood and watched.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s not talking. But a search of his apartment turned up a pair of gloves with traces of Melanie Rogers' blood on it. They also found a fake beard and a baseball cap just like McManus’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So McManus could be seen at the conference by security. It’s all part of the setup.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Melanie met Noah a bunch of times. She probably recognized him on the day, wondered what he was doing, and followed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If she got on to him he would have had no choice but to kill her.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: What a shame.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: She was a sweet kid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Got a sec?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did a little digging into that driver of yours. Turns out you’re not his only employer, Senator.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We took a look into his financials. There’s a series of large deposits into his checking account.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Let me guess. Untraceable wire transfers bounced through shadow accounts and Switzerland and the Middle East.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like you would have done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks, guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know who’s behind this, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I have my suspicions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Someone who’s gotten rich making powerful people promises that I need to keep. What does a kingmaker do when the king no longer follows orders?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need a name.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: You’ve done enough, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Senator, that person is still out there and I have no way of getting to him. You’re not safe.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’m touched by your concern. But I think maybe you forget who you’re dealing with.

utterance.speaker: HOWARD
utterance.content: Sir, we have to leave. You’re already 30 minutes behind schedule.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, would you uh, walk me out?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: You saved my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you can’t win ‘em all, can you?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I suppose this means I’m in your debt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing’s changed between us, Senator.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Even so. It’s a dangerous world out there, Detective. You never know when you might need a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: McManus’ son. Was that you?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: If I said no, would you really believe me?

utterance.speaker: HOWARD
utterance.content: The Senator is very busy –

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. I’ll – I’ll make a statement. As you all know, last night an attempt was made on my life. Even though I was not able to introduce my initiative at the eco conference, it has only strengthened my resolve to move forward with this historic piece of legislation.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: And I would like to especially thank the brave men and women of the New York City Police Department who thwarted this plot.

utterance.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterance.content: And in a shocking development, Federal Agents arrested Benjamin Moss, founder of the powerful super-PAC American Way, after connecting him to payments made to the Senator’s would-be assassin. Moss, a former presidential –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My God. It was Ben Moss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Biggest kingmaker of them all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Bracken only had him arrested. The way he was talking I half expected the guy to die in a “plane crash” or some kind of mysterious “car accident”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Look, this is so much better. Now Bracken’s a folk hero. The rare politician willing to stand up to special interests and fight for what’s right, even if it costs him his life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. That’s a better story. The kind of story that could make a guy President.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’ll slip up eventually and when he does, I’ll be ready.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
